709751f.text:
Seventh Avenue, west side, south from West 33rd to 31st Street's, showing the excavation for the Pennsylvania Railroad Station. This will occupy this entire two scuare blocks; Eighth Avenue being on the right. The additional excavation in the right center is for the power house that will be located on the opposite side of 31st Street. The R. C. Church and School of St. John the Baptist appear at the left. The school is on 31st Street and the church on
30th Street.
About 1907
Ewing Galloway
Neog,~ 232G

709739f-a.text:
Seventh Ave., at the S.E. corner of West 31st Street. The Hotel Governor Clinton will be erected here (1928-29).
August 20, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

730207f-a.title: General view - 7th Avenue - Northeast.
730207f-a.text:
383 Seventh Avenue, iEuitable Life Assurance Co. Building), east siue, from W. 31st to 32nd Streets. (;eneral view northeastwardJ.
A view over Gimbel's and Macy's roofs towards the Fifth Avenue zone,to show there the steel Irame work of the skyscraper No. 10 E. 40th Street. At the lett, under the steam cloud is tne New York Times Building with its distinctive. tower.
April 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr

712009f-a.text:
W. 31st Street (fo:eground) between Severth and Eihuth (left) Averues, showinm the south entraance to hPe Pennsylvania Station on the north side of this thorouchfare. Phxtomraphers vantage point is No. 352 Seventh Averue and from which he is viewinc nortbwestwardd to show higher strugtures on the north sidde of W. 33rd Street, west from Eighth Avenue. Of these. the 22 storied Printing WWrafts Building is outstanding and occupies the entire west side frontage of Eighth Avenue from 33rd to 34th Streets. At the left appears the quadrangular Post Office.
Mav 3, 1928.
P.L. Sperr

212-204 West 31st Street, west of and adjoining the S.W. corner of Seventh Avenue. This is the School of St. JJohn the Baptist.

709754f-a.text:
Seventh Ave., west side, north from West 31st, to and including West 34th Streets, showing the Pennsylvania Railroad Station, as it extends to West 33rd Street. In the right background is seen the Nelson Tower,
between West 34th and West 35th Streets.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.

709742f.text:
Seventh Avenue, west side, from W. 31st to 33rd Street, showing the automobile runway at Pennsylvania Station. The station proper is on the left; W. 31st Street on the right, and 7th Avenue in the
background.
1939
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Ales. Alland, IRGV.
